testCases.explanation: A 1x1 board with a single queen is the only solution.
No valid arrangement exists for 2 queens on a 2x2 board.
No valid arrangement exists for 3 queens on a 3x3 board.
Exactly 2 distinct solutions for n=4. Queens placed such that no two share a row, column, or diagonal.

description:
The n-queens puzzle is the problem of placing `n` queens on an `n x n` chessboard such that no two queens attack each other.

Given an integer `n`, return all distinct solutions to the n-queens puzzle. You may return the answer in any order.

Each solution contains a distinct board configuration of the n-queens' placement, where `'Q'` and `'.'` both indicate a queen and an empty space, respectively.

See the full problem on [LeetCode 51](https://leetcode.com/problems/n-queens/).

examples.explanation: There exist two distinct solutions to the 4-queens puzzle.
